# Stage 1 - Information Centre and Maintenance Compound Fire Suppression Replacement, Jasper National Park

## Tender Information

* Reference Number: cb-5177-27792249
* Solicitation Number: 5P468-23-0047/A
* Publication Date: 2023-05-02
* Tender Closing Date: 2023-05-17T16:00:00
* Amended Date: 2023-05-17
* Expected Contract Start Date: 2023-06-09
* Expected Contract End Date: 2023-12-21

## Project Description
The Parks Canada Agency requires a qualified contractor to perform repairs and reconstruction of existing fire suppression systems in two buildings within Jasper National Park. The work includes decommissioning of an existing glycol system in the attic and porches of the Jasper Information Centre and replacing it with a dry system, as well as expanding coverage within interior portions of the building to meet hazard occupancy requirements. Additionally, the Maintenance Compound will require full-scale replacement and expansion of the wet and dry systems due to aging components and to address changes in hazard occupancy. The contractor will perform general contracting tasks, including fire suppression system installation, alarm panel retrofitting, and other associated work.

## Tender Requirements
Bidders are required to submit their qualifications and a financial bid in two stages. Stage 1 will evaluate the qualifications of interested suppliers, while Stage 2 will invite qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid on the project. Bidders must submit their bids via email or fax, as stated in the solicitation document.

## Delivery and Payment
The contractor shall complete the work no later than December 21, 2023. The estimated value of the project is between $1,000,001 and $5,000,000, exclusive of taxes.

## Important Dates

* Tender Closing Date: 2023-05-17T16:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: 2023-06-09
* Expected Contract End Date: 2023-12-21

## Contact Information
For technical and contractual inquiries, please contact Aarondeep Maan at Aarondeep.maan@pc.gc.ca or (403) 585-7139.

## Critical Notes

* Bidders must submit their bids via email or fax, as stated in the solicitation document.
* Late submissions will not be considered.
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language
